text:
I suspect that you'll end up chasing your tail. A while back I spent three days doing a deep dive into BSP. Despite the explanations and examples in the Betfair docs and FAQs being pretty clear and understandable, Across dozens of races, I was unable to accurately calculate a single BSP price from data collected at the end of market streams. Sometimes the variances were surprisingly large.

One surprise was how often very large sums appear in the last few moments before the market suspends. I'm not sure whether these were trying to catch favourable prices, or move the BSP calculation. I wondered whether some my inability to accurately calculate BSPs was due to monies arriving in time to be included in the auction, but too late to reported in the BSP ladder - otherwise it may be off book transactions, possibly with other parts of the Flutter empire, but that's speculation.

I doubt that you'll be able to come up with much beyond a rough rule of thumb along the lines of the obvious "if there's lots of money going into the BSP auction, you won't affect the price significantly, but if the liquidity is low, you will". However, you could spend an awful lot of time trying!

text: Thanks for your thoughtful respons, you've confirmed what I've suspected, which is very helpful. I've also made several attempts to estimate it and have figured that logging the pre-off BSP liabilities and stakes gets very close. Also it seems doubtful that these are the final amounts matched at BSP because then you could move BSP quite significantly if that were the case. At least now I know my 20 pound bets won't destroy the market :joy:
